abstract.t: RFC3552/BCP72 describes an Internet Threat model that has been used in Internet protocol design. More than sixteen years have passed since RFC3552 was written and the structure and topology of the Internet has changed. With those changes comes a question: has the Internet Threat Model really changed? Or, is the model described in RFC3552 still largely accurate? This draft attempts to describe an non-exhaustive list of changes in the current threat environment. It suggests that there are both qualitative and quantitative differences from the environment described in RFC3552 and is intended as input to the IAB program on the Internet threat model started in 2020.
